doc.field: Benjamin and Muriel Goldring Papers and Photographs
Benjamin and Muriel Goldring Papers and Photographs
Series IV: Rosenberg and Sobell Cases
Series IV: Rosenberg and Sobell Cases

This series contains administrative files and publicity materials produced by the National Committee to Reopen the Rosenberg Case and the Committee to Free Morton Sobell, as well as other materials documenting the work of both organizations. Notable is Ben Goldring's correspondence with Morton Sobell's legal team, Murie Goldring's correspondence with Helen Sobell and with Aaron Katz (director of the National Committee to Reopen the Rosenberg Case), copies of material on the Rosenberg trial released under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), and a draft of a book-length work by William A. Reuben on the Rosenberg case, with annotations by Ben Goldring.
Benjamin and Muriel Goldring Papers and Photographs
